medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 4 months before admission with shortness of breath, worsening over time. Nighttime chest tightness, fever, coughing, and dyspnea on exertion started about 3 months prior. Following a previous diagnosis of community-acquired pneumonia and treatment with antibiotics, increasing dyspnea and cough developed 2.5 months prior to admission. A 2-week course of prednisone resulted in some improvement in cough and energy but persistent dyspnea, which worsened with minimal activity and increased at night.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Eczema since age 14, anemia of uncertain cause, history of cellulitis caused by methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) previous year, herpes zoster three times in the past, intentional weight loss of more than 45 kg over 14 months (followed by a recent gain of 10 kg), and Raynaud's phenomenon for 1.5 years.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had hyperlipidemia and thyroid disease; father is deceased; children are healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Married with children; lived in the midwestern and southern United States and New England; does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
